Led byStuart Murdoch (musician)Stuart Murdoch, the band has released 9 albums to date.CitationTaylorSteveSteve TaylorThe A to X of Alternative Music[[Continuum International Publishing Group]]200430–310-8264-8217-1CitationStrongMartin CharlesThe Great Rock Discography: Complete Discographies Listing Every Track Recorded By More Than 1200 Artists[[Canongate U.S.]]20041221-84195-615-5Though often praised by critics,CitationCloonanMartinPopular Music and the State in the UK: Culture, Trade Or Industry?[[Ashgate Publishing]]20071200-7546-5373-0http://books.google.com/books?idCitationGardinerMichaelModern Scottish Culture[[Edinburgh University Press]]20052030-7486-2027-3http://books.google.com/books?idBelle and Sebastian has enjoyed only limited commercial success.
After releasing a number of albums and EPs onJeepster Records, they are now signed toRough Trade Recordsin the United Kingdom andMatador Recordsin the United States.
article.heading: History
Formation and early years (19961998)
article.paragraph: Belle and Sebastian were formed in Glasgow, Scotland in 1996 byStuart Murdoch (musician)Stuart MurdochandStuart David.Together, withStow Collegemusic professorAlan Rankine, they recorded some demos; these demos were picked up by the college's Music Business course that produces and releases one single each year on the college's label,Electric Honey (label)Electric Honey. As the band had a number of songs already and the label was extremely impressed with the demos, Belle and Sebastian were allowed to record a full-length album, which was titledTigermilk. Murdoch once described the band as a "product of botched capitalism".

Tigermilkwas recorded in three days and originally only one thousand copies were pressed onGramophone recordvinyl.These original copies now sell for up to 400.CitationParelesJohnThe Rolling Stone Encyclopedia of Rock & Roll[[Fireside Publishing]]2001660-7432-0120-5CitationShielGeorgeTigermilkhttp://www.eclectichoney.com/tigermilk.htmlEclectic Honey4 November 2007[http://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?hlhttp://web.archive.org/web/20070616110535/http://www.eclectichoney.com/tigermilk.html16 June 2007CitationBelle and Sebastian 2nd Melbourne show!http://www.pbsfm.org.au/Documents.asp?IDPBS 106.7FM4 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20070916203738/http://pbsfm.org.au/Documents.asp?ID16 September 2007The warm reception the album received inspired Murdoch and David to turn the band into a full-time project, recruitingStevie Jackson(guitar and vocals),Isobel Campbell(cello/vocals),Chris Geddes(keys) andRichard Colburn(drums) to fill out the group.

After the success of the debut album, Belle and Sebastian were signed toJeepster Recordsin August 1996 andIf You're Feeling Sinister, their second album, was released on 18 November.The album was named bySpin (magazine)Spinas one of the 100 greatest albums between 1985 and 2005,Citation100 Greatest Albums, 1985–2005http://www.spin.com/articles/100-greatest-albums-1985-2005Spin20 June 200511 November 2007and is widely considered the band's masterpiece.Just before the recording ofSinister,Sarah Martin (musician)Sarah Martin(violin/vocals) joined the band. Following this a series of EPs were released in 1997.CitationHornbyNickLazy Line Painter Janehttp://www.salon.com/music/sharps/1997/11/14sharps.htmlSalon14 November 19975 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071210214633/http://www.salon.com/music/sharps/1997/11/14sharps.html10 December 2007noThe first of these wasDog on Wheels, which contained four demo tracks recorded before the real formation of the band. In fact, the only long-term band members to play on the songs were Murdoch, David, andMick Cooke, who played trumpet on the EP but would not officially join the band until a few years later. It charted at No. 59 in the UK singles chart.

TheLazy Line Painter JaneEP followed in July. The track was recorded in the church where Murdoch livedCitationLimDennisWinter of Their Youthhttp://www.villagevoice.com/1998-09-15/music/winter-of-their-youth/The Village Voice15 September 19985 November 2007and features vocals fromMonica Queen. The EP narrowly missed out on the UK top 40, peaking at No. 41.The last of the 1997 EPs was October's3.. 6.. 9 Seconds of Light. The EP was made Single of the Week in both theNMEandMelody Makerand reached No. 32 in the charts, thus becoming the band's first top 40 single.
article.heading: Critical acclaim (19982000)
article.paragraph: ListenBelle-Sebastian-The boy with the arab strap.ogg "The Boy with the Arab Strap" The title of the album, ''[[The Boy with the Arab Strap]]'' caused some tension between Belle and Sebastian and fellow Scots band [[Arab Strap (band)|Arab Strap]].{{Citation |lastThe band released their third LP,The Boy with the Arab Strapin 1998, and it reached No. 12 in the UK charts.CitationBestSophieRing the Bellehttp://www.theage.com.au/articles/2004/07/22/1090464785300.htmlThe AgeAustralia23 July 20045 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071210205932/http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2004/07/22/1090464785300.html10 December 2007noArab Strapgarnered positive reviews fromRolling StoneCitationRatliffBenThe Boy With the Arab Strap reviewhttp://www.rollingstone.com/artists/belleandsebastian/albums/album/103457/review/5941160/the_boy_with_the_arab_straphttp://web.archive.org/web/20071027105615/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/belleandsebastian/albums/album/103457/review/5941160/the_boy_with_the_arab_strap27 October 2007''Rolling Stone25 August 199811 November 2007and theVillage Voice,among others; however, the album has its detractors,CitationOwingsHenryThe Overrated Book[[Last Gasp]]20060-86719-657-2includingPitchfork Media, who gave the album a particularly poor review, calling it a "parody" of their earlier work (Pitchfork has since removed the review from their website).CitationJosephesJasonThe Boy With the Arab Strap reviewhttp://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/record_review/15372-the-boy-with-the-arab-straphttp://web.archive.org/web/20071221210634/http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/record_review/15372-the-boy-with-the-arab-strap21 December 2007Pitchfork Media1 October 199811 November 2007–[http://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?hlDuring the recording of the album, long-time studio trumpet-player Mick Cooke was asked to join the band as a full member.TheThis Is Just a Modern Rock SongEP followed later that year.CitationMODERN LOVERS ROCK HARDhttp://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian/676NMEUK26 October 19985 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071130035719/http://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian/67630 November 2007no

In 1999 the band was awarded with Best Newcomer (for their third album) at theBRIT Awards, upsetting better-known acts such asSteps (band)Stepsand5ive.CitationRobbie rules over Britshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/special_report/1999/02/99/brit_awards/280847.stmBBC17 February 19994 November 2007That same year, the band hosted their own festival, theBowlie Weekender.Tigermilkwas also given a full release byJeepster RecordsJeepsterbefore the band started work on their next LP. The result wasFold Your Hands Child, You Walk Like a Peasant, which became the band's first top 10 album in the UK.A stand-alone single, "Legal Man", reached No. 15 and gave them their first appearance onTop of the Pops.CitationUrbanAndySide Project Becomes Full-Length Let Downhttp://www.dustedmagazine.com/reviews/237Dusted Magazine18 June 20024 November 2007File:Belle and Sebastian performing.jpgthumb230pxBelle and Sebastian performing at the9:30 Clubin Washington, D.C.As the band's popularity and recognition was growing worldwide, their music began appearing in films and on television. The 2000 filmHigh Fidelity (film)High Fidelitymentions the band and features a clip from the song "Seymour Stein" fromThe Boy with the Arab Strap.CitationZacharekStephanieHigh Fidelityhttp://www.salon.com/entertainment/movies/review/2000/03/31/high_fidelity/print.htmlSalon31 March 20005 November 2007Also, the title track fromArab Strapwas played over the end credits of the UK television seriesTeachers (UK TV series)Teachers,CitationVirtueGraemeJingle Book Belleshttp://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4156/is_20031221/ai_n12585237Sunday Herald21 December 20034 November 2007and the lyric "Color my life with the chaos of trouble" from the song was quoted by one of the characters in the 2009 film(500) Days of Summer.
article.heading: Line-up and label changes (2000–2005)
article.paragraph: Stuart Davidsoon left the band to concentrate on his side project,Looper (band)Looper, and his book writing, which included hisThe Idle Thoughts of a Daydreamer.CitationHeimJoeSharps & Flats: Looperhttp://www.salon.com/entertainment/music/review/2000/05/09/looper/index.htmlSalon9 May 20005 November 2007He was replaced byBobby KildeaofV-Twin (band)V-Twin. The "Jonathan David" single, sung by Stevie Jackson, was released in June 2001 and was followed by "I'm Waking Up to Us" in November. "I'm Waking Up to Us" saw the band use an outside producer (Mike Hurst (producer)Mike Hurst) for the first time.CitationSturgesFionaPop: Scots of the arch anticshttp://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4158/is_20011130/ai_n14433572The IndependentUK30 November 20015 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071210184343/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4158/is_20011130/ai_n1443357210 December 2007Most of 2002 was spent touring and recording a soundtrack album,Storytelling (Belle and Sebastian album)Storytelling(forStorytelling (film)StorytellingbyTodd Solondz).CitationNicholsPeter M.The New York Times Guide to the Best 1,000 Movies Ever Made[[St. Martin's Press]]20049550-312-32611-4Campbell left the band in the spring of 2002, in the middle of the band's North American tour.CitationHansenLianeIsobel Campbell: After Belle Comes 'Ballad'http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyIdNational Public Radio19 March 20064 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071213050305/http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId13 December 2007noCitationErlewineStephen ThomasBelle and Sebastian: Full Biographyhttp://www.mtv.com/music/artist/belle_sebastian_1/artist.jhtml#bioMTV4 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071012020424/http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/belle_sebastian_1/artist.jhtml12 October 2007no

The band left Jeepster in 2002, signing a four-album deal withRough Trade Records.CitationMcGregorAndrewBelle and Sebastian, Dear Catastrophe Waitresshttp://www.bbc.co.uk/music/reviews/znrgBBC21 June 20014 November 2007Their first album for Rough Trade,Dear Catastrophe Waitress, was released in 2003, and was produced byTrevor Horn.CitationMcCrackenEddSecret seven win throughhttp://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4156/is_20031005/ai_n12586361Sunday Herald5 October 20034 November 2007The album showed a markedly more "produced" sound compared to their first four LPs,CitationGrantKieranBelle and Sebastian Q&Ahttp://www.eyeweekly.com/eye/issue/issue_11.06.03/music/qa2.phpEye Weekly6 November 20035 November 2007as the band was making a concerted effort to produce more "radio-friendly" music.The album was warmly received and is credited with restoring the band's "indie cred".The album also marked the return of Murdoch as the group's primary songwriter, following the poorly receivedFold Your Hands Child, You Walk Like a PeasantandStorytelling, both of which were more collaborative than the band's early work.CitationRaihalaRossBelle and Sebastian pouring out their souls – againhttp://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/entertainment/2002878317_bellesebastian21.htmlSeattle Times21 March 20066 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071210215308/http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/entertainment/2002878317_bellesebastian21.html10 December 2007noA documentary DVD,Fans Only, was released by Jeepster in October 2003, featuring promotional videos, live clips and unreleased footage.A single from the album, "Step into My Office, Baby" followed in November 2003; it would be their first single taken from an album.

TheThin Lizzy-inspired "I'm a Cuckoo" was the second single from the album.CitationDevenishColinBelle & Sebastian Back in Townhttp://www.rollingstone.com/artists/belleandsebastian/articles/story/5936950/belle__sebastian_back_in_townhttp://web.archive.org/web/20071210214213/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/belleandsebastian/articles/story/5936950/belle__sebastian_back_in_town10 December 2007Rolling Stone27 October 20035 November 2007It achieved their highest chart position yet, reaching No. 14 in the UK.TheBooks (EP)BooksEP followed, a double A-side single led by "Wrapped Up in Books" fromDear Catastrophe Waitressand the new "Your Cover's Blown". This EP became the band's third top 20 UK release, and the band was nominated for both theMercury Music Prizeand anIvor Novello Award. In January 2005, B&S was voted Scotland's greatest band in a poll byThe List (magazine)The List, beatingSimple Minds,Idlewild (band)Idlewild,Travis (band)Travis,Franz Ferdinand (band)Franz Ferdinand, andThe Proclaimers, among others.CitationStrongMartin C.The Essential Rock Discography[[Open City Books]]2006801-84195-860-3
article.heading: Return to success (2005–2010)
article.paragraph: In April 2005, members of the band visitedIsraeland thePalestinian territorieswith the UK charityWar on Want;the group subsequently recorded a song inspired by the trip titled "The Eighth Station of the Cross Kebab House", which would first appear on the digital-download version of the charity albumHelp!: A Day in the Lifeand would later have a physical release as a B-side on 2006's "Funny Little Frog" single.Push Barman to Open Old Wounds, a compilation of the Jeepster singles and EPs, was released in May 2005 while the band were recording their seventh album in California. The result of the sessions wasThe Life Pursuit, produced byTony Hoffer.CitationPetridisAlexisBelle and Sebastian, The Life Pursuithttp://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2006/feb/03/popandrock.shopping9The GuardianLondon3 February 20065 November 2007CitationBeaujonAndrewThe Happiness Of 'Pursuit'http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/02/07/AR2006020701798.htmlWashington Post8 February 20065 November 2007The album, originally intended to be a double album,CitationMcBayNadineBelle & Sebastian: We managed to do things without pandering to the London machinehttp://drownedinsound.com/in_depth/580171-belle-sebastian--we-managed-to-do-things-without-pandering-to-the-london-machineDrowned In Sound19 January 20064 November 2007became the band's highest-charting album upon its release in February 2006, peaking at No. 8 in the UK and No. 65 on the USBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200.CitationHarrisChrisJack Johnson Scores First Billboard No. 1 With 'Curious' Tuneshttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1524351/20060215/johnson_jack.jhtmlMTV15 February 20065 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071213055146/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1524351/20060215/johnson_jack.jhtml13 December 2007noCitationBelle & Sebastian get the 'Blues' on new singlehttp://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian/22384NMEUK3 March 20065 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071130035714/http://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian/2238430 November 2007no"Funny Little Frog", which preceded it, also proved to be their highest-charting single, debuting at No. 13.CitationSannehKelefaCRITIC'S NOTEBOOK; A Quiet Band Worth Fighting Loudly About Makes Some More Noisehttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resNew York Times2 February 20065 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071211024132/http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res11 December 2007no

On 6 July 2006, the band played a historicCitation neededJanuary 2014show with theLos Angeles Philharmonicat theHollywood Bowl.CitationRosenStevenBelle & Sebastian with the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestrahttp://harpmagazine.com/reviews/concert_reviews/detail.cfm?articleHarp Magazine6 June 20064 November 2007The opening act at the 18,000 seat sell-out concert wasThe Shins.CitationMancinaKristinBelle & Sebastian and the Los Angeles Philharmonic Featuring the Shinshttp://www.lasplash.com/publish/Entertainment/cat_index_la_events/Belle_Sebastian_and_the_Los_Angeles_Philharmonic_Featuring_the_Shins.phpL.A. Splash Magazine4 November 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20071210221900/http://www.lasplash.com/publish/Entertainment/cat_index_la_events/Belle_Sebastian_and_the_Los_Angeles_Philharmonic_Featuring_the_Shins.php10 December 2007noThe members of the band see this as a landmark event, with Stevie Jackson saying, "This is the biggest thrill of my entire life".CitationWenerBenBelle and Sebastian: Delightful in every wayhttp://www.ocregister.com/entertainment/group-143025-never-anything.htmlOrange County Register7 July 20064 November 2007In October 2006, members of the band helped put together a CD collection of new songs for children titledColours Are Brighter, with the involvement of major bands such asFranz Ferdinand (band)Franz FerdinandandThe Flaming Lips.CitationLlewellynKatieBelle & Sebastian-Curated Kids' Comp Details Revealedhttp://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/news/37461-belle-sebastian-curated-kids-comp-details-revealedhttp://web.archive.org/web/20071214234310/http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/news/37461-belle-sebastian-curated-kids-comp-details-revealed14 December 2007Pitchfork Media18 July 20064 November 2007–[http://scholar.google.co.uk/scholar?hl

On 18 November 2008 the band releasedThe BBC Sessions (Belle and Sebastian album)The BBC Sessions, which features songs from the period of 19962001 (including the last recordings featuring Isobel Campbell before she left the band), along with a second disc featuring a recording of a live performance inBelfastfrom Christmas 2001.CitationThompsonPaulBelle and Sebastian Collect BBC Sessions on New Comphttp://pitchfork.com/news/33520-belle-and-sebastian-collect-ibbc-sessionsi-on-new-comp/Pitchfork Media18 September 20085 November 2008
article.heading: Recent years (2010present)
article.paragraph: On 17 July 2010, the band performed their first UK gig in almost four years to a crowd of around 30,000 atLatitude Festivalin Henham Park, Southwold.cite webhttp://www.latitudefestival.co.uk/2010/lineup/artist.aspx.AIDLine-up – Latitude Festival 2011Latitudefestival.co.uk7 April 2011They performed two new songs, "I Didn't See It Coming" and "I'm Not Living in the Real World".cite webhttp://www.setlist.fm/setlist/belle-and-sebastian/2010/latitude-festival-southwold-england-1bd46130.htmlBelle and Sebastian Concert Setlist at Latitude Festival, Southwold on July 17, 2010setlist.fm7 April 2011

Their eighth studio album, released in the UK and internationally on 25 September 2010, was titledBelle and Sebastian Write About Love.cite webhttp://www.belleandsebastian.com/newsstory.php?idNewsBelle and Sebastian7 April 2011yeshttps://web.archive.org/20101124093353/http://www.belleandsebastian.com:80/newsstory.php?id24 November 2010The first single from the album, as well as the record's title track "Write About Love (song)Write About Love", was released in the US on 7 September 2010.Write About Loveentered the UK albums chart in its first week of release, peaking at No. 8 as of 19 October 2010.cite webhttp://www.theofficialcharts.com/archive-chart/_/3/2010-10-23/Archive ChartTheofficialcharts.com23 October 201024 November 2010
In December 2010 Belle and Sebastian curated the sequel to theBowlie Weekenderin the form ofBowlie 2presented byAll Tomorrow's Parties (music festival)All Tomorrow's Parties.

In 2013,PitchforkmediaPitchfork TVreleased an hour-long documentary in February, directed by RJ Bentler which focused on the band's 1996 albumIf You're Feeling Sinister, as well as the formation and early releases of the band. The documentary featured interviews with every member that was present on the album, as well as several archival photos and videos from the band's early days.cite webhttp://pitchfork.com/news/49599-pitchforktv-presents-a-documentary-on-belle-and-sebastians-if-youre-feeling-sinister/Pitchfork.tv Presents a Documentary Film on Belle and Sebastian's If You're Feeling Sinister2013-02-19Pitchfork2013-02-18Pitchforkmedia.comThe band compiled a second compilation albumThe Third Eye Centrewhich included the b-sides and rarities released afterPush Barman to Open Old Wounds, from the albumsDear Catastrophe Waitress,The Life Pursuit, andWrite About Love. In an interview at the end of 2013,cite webInterview: Mick Cooke (formerly) of Belle & Sebastianhttp://www.thecurrent.org/feature/2013/12/11/interview-mick-cooke-formerly-of-belle-and-sebastianThe Current4 June 2014Mick Cooke confirmed he had left the band on good terms.

The band received an 'Outstanding Contribution To Music Award' at theNME Awards2014.cite webBelle & Sebastian win Outstanding Contribution To Music Award at NME Awards 2014 with Austin, Texashttp://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian/75556NME.com4 June 2014

In 2014, the band returned to the studio, recording inAtlanta,Georgia (U.S. state)Georgiafor their ninth studio album,cite webBelle And Sebastian confirm new album recording sessionshttp://www.nme.com/news/belle-and-sebastian--2/77572NME.com4 June 2014along with announcing tour dates for various festivals and concerts across the world during 2014.cite webLive Dateshttp://www.belleandsebastian.com/live-datesBelle and Sebastian official website4 June 2014Their ninth albumGirls in Peacetime Want to Dancewas released on 19 January 2015.The Glasgow veterans flit between acoustic indie and disco bangers on their camp and scatterbrained ninth album, nme.com, by Dan Stubbs , 14 January 2015
Belle and Sebastian performed at the world famous Glastonbury Festival on Sunday 28 June 2015, on 'The Other Stage'.
